meanings.sent1: The declinational angle of the sun determines the length of shadows.
meanings.sent2: She studied the declinational changes in magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The declinational weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His declinational mood mirrored the gray clouds overhead.
meanings.sent5: The declinational patterns in bird migration are fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: The act or process of declining or decreasing.
meanings.sent1: The declinational of sales was a cause for concern for the company.
meanings.sent2: She observed a steady declinational in the population of the endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The declinational of the cake at the party was unexpected but welcomed.
meanings.sent4: The declinational of the stock market sent shockwaves through the economy.
meanings.sent5: The declinational of his interest in the hobby was gradual but noticeable.
